value.title: Manage your Azure IoT Hub with alerts and metrics
value.excerpt: Learn about metrics, alerts, diagnostics, and logs. Create an Azure IoT Hub, an app to send vibration telemetry, and then create and test some metrics and alerts.

value.title: Monitor performance of virtual machines by using Azure Monitor for VMs
value.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure Monitor for VMs to monitor your organization's Azure virtual machines.

value.title: Optimize Azure costs with data analysis in Power BI
value.excerpt: Use Power BI to understand where your money is being spent in Azure so you can help your organization to optimize its costs.

value.title: Predict flight delays by creating a machine learning model in Python
value.excerpt: Import airline arrival data into a Jupyter notebook and use Pandas to clean it. Then, build a machine learning model with Scikit-Learn and use Matplotlib to visualize output.

images.title: Predict flight delays by creating a machine learning model in Python

value.title: Prepare your development environment for Azure development
value.excerpt: Learn how to choose and install the appropriate IDE for your requirements to help you build, deploy, monitor, and scale cloud-hosted solutions.

value.title: Protect your virtual machine settings with Azure Automation State Configuration
value.excerpt: Learn how to protect your virtual machine settings with Azure Automation State Configuration

value.title: Provide disaster recovery by replicating storage data across regions and failing over to secondary location
value.excerpt: Learn how to provide disaster recovery by replicating storage data across regions and failing over to secondary location.

value.title: Publish a web app to Azure with Visual Studio
value.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure App Service to create a new ASP.NET-based web app, then publish and update directly from Visual Studio.

value.title: Publish and manage your APIs with Azure API Management
value.excerpt: Learn about using an Azure API gateway to share APIs with partners, and how to use subscription keys to control access to your APIs.

value.title: Read and write data in Azure Databricks
value.excerpt: Read and write data in Azure Databricks

value.title: Secure an ASP.NET Core web app with the Identity framework
value.excerpt: Add authentication and authorization to an ASP.NET Core web app using the Identity framework.

value.title: Transcribe speech input to text
value.excerpt: Speech to text from the speech service, known as speech recognition, enables real time transcription of audio streams into text. Your applications, tools, or devices can consume, display, and take action on this text as command input.

value.title: Use unsupervised learning to analyze unlabeled data
value.excerpt: Use unsupervised learning methods to predict groupings in data. Use variations of k-means clustering and spectral clustering to analyze and visualize difficult data sets.

images.title: Use unsupervised learning to analyze unlabeled data

value.title: Work with DataFrames in Azure Databricks
value.excerpt: Work with DataFrames in Azure Databricks

value.title: Azure API for FHIR (Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources) | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Michael Hansen joins Scott Hanselman to explain what FHIR is and how to get started with FHIR on Azure. Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (or, FHIR) is a new standard for representing and exchanging healthcare data. Developed by the HL7 community to address problems with interoperability, pieces

value.title: Azure Automation | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Jenny Hunter joins Scott Hanselman to discuss Azure Automation, which has seen several new improvements including support for Python 2, the ability to run against local Linux machines, the ability to run against any Azure VM with no setup (Run Command), and native Azure alert integration. value.excerpt: Raj Ganapathy joins Scott Hanselman to discuss the new addition to Azure's resiliency offerings – Availability Zones. value.excerpt: Even though Azure takes three copies of your virtual machines and stores them in Azure Storage, you still need to protect your data against ransomware, corruption, or accidental deletion.
